column4: Q: how do I disable the zoom effect (this black frame) for resizing windows?
we can not actually see what you see. which window manager are you using?
I use ordenary ubuntu I guess, how do I find out more data that might help you?
i don't know of a zoom in standard ubuntu. beryl has got a zoom. have you installed beryl or compiz?
it's doinf it when I minimize a window to the taskbar, e.g
ahhh. you mean it is a minimize animation?
that must be it
just an empty  wireframe
I found an option in gconf-editor in /desktop/gnome/interface/enable_animations
found that. do you think I have to restart x to apply the change?
no, the changes should be seen immediately i think. maybe you need to log out.
I will do that and report back, t.y. so far
that didn't do the trick
how about /apps/panel/global/enable_animations? (sorry i can not be more precise, i don't use gnome myself)
need to relog, brb
nope, still no luck, and I disabled all the occurances of "animation" in gconf
then i have no idea...
no biggie, thanks for your suggestions!
I found a semi solution: /apps/metacity/general/reduced_resources if ticked the animation is gone, but you only see a wireframe of the window if you move it.
typical. gnome (or metacity as the window manager is called) is making it difficult to tweak things nowadays.
you can replace metacity with something else if you like though (I won't go into details about that since you have so many to choose from)
thanks for the info, I will diig deep into that matter
